title: Who is John Bolton? Ex-Trump adviser indicted in documents probe
shortDescription: Former national security advisor during President Trump’s first term, John Bolton was indicted on Oct. 16 as part of a classified documents probe.

title: Trump's deployment of National Guard troops faces backlash
shortDescription: President Donald Trump's deployment of National Guard troops to US cities raises questions about the role of the military in civic life.

title: Trump critic John Bolton indicted in documents investigation
shortDescription: Ex-National Security Adviser John Bolton, a longtime critic of President Donald Trump, was indicted amid a probe of mishandling classified documents.

title: Trump seeks to lower costs, expand access to IVF treatment
shortDescription: Trump's plan calls for lowering the cost of fertility treatments and eliminating red tape for employers who want to expand access for workers.

title: Trump barred from deploying troops to his Chicago 'Midway Blitz' plan
shortDescription: The U.S. Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit's decision upholds a temporary restraining order granted by a federal judge in Chicago.

shortDescription: As President Donald Trump pushes to deploy more National Guard troops to US cities, Americans grapple with show of military might.

title: President Trump to meet Putin in Budapest
shortDescription: President Donald Trump says he’ll meet Russian President Vladimir Putin in Budapest to negotiate Ukraine peace after phone call.

title: Arc de Trump: President Trump reveals 3-D model
shortDescription: President Trump showed plans for a new real estate project at a dinner to thank donors for his $250 million ballroom at the White House.

shortDescription: President Donald Trump's company launched a new enterprise selling golden phones. The T1 Phone was scheduled to be released in October. Where is it?

title: Government shutdown update after another vote

title: Trump, Putin agree to meet in Budapest to seek end to 'inglorious' war
shortDescription: President Trump said he and Vladimir Putin agreed Thursday, Oct. 16 to meet in Budapest to work on an agreement to end Russia's war in Ukraine.

title: Trump admin will reportedly ask grand jury to indict John Bolton
shortDescription: The Justice Department is reportedly planning to seek a grand jury's indictment of ex-National Security Adviser John Bolton, a major Trump critic.

shortDescription: In response to a Young Republicans leaked group chat, Vice President JD Vance said "kids do stupid things" while on "The Charlie Kirk Show."

title: Governor vs. Bernie-backed oysterman in fight to topple GOP senator
shortDescription: Maine Gov. Janet Mills announced her candidacy for U.S. Senate, setting up a race that may serve as a proxy for the direction of the Democratic party.

title: Government shutdown latest: Another Senate vote fails
shortDescription: Democrats and Republicans are still deadlocked as the Senate failed to muster enough votes on the House-passed Republican bill
